citeinfo.origin: Johnson, Adam G., U.S. Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: Land Use for the Island of Maui, Hawaii, circa 2010

descript.abstract: This dataset is a map of land use and vegetation for the Island of Maui, Hawaii, circa 2010. This dataset is a modified version of the U.S. Geological Survey LANDFIRE Existing Vegetation Type map (LANDFIRE.HI_110EVT, Refresh 2008) for the Island of Maui, Hawaii. The LANDFIRE Existing Vegetation Type map was modified to create this map of land use and vegetation for use in a water-budget model. Modifications included converting the LANDFIRE Existing Vegetation Type map from a raster to a shapefile format, assigning land-use names, and adding golf-course and crop boundaries.
descript.purpose: This dataset was developed for use in a water-budget model that computes groundwater recharge, fog drip, irrigation, evapotranspiration, and runoff.

browse.browsed: Graphic representation of the data set

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143

dataqual.logic: No gaps or overlaps were found in this shapefile
dataqual.complete: All fields for all features are attributed.

procstep.procdesc: Convert LANDFIRE Existing Vegetation Type map from a raster to a polygon shapefile.
Project coordinate system from NAD 1983 Albers to NAD 1983 UTM Zone 4N.

Merge each polygon that has an area less than 3,600 square meters, other than those with an "Open Water" land-use name, with an adjacent polygon that has an area of at least 3,600 square meters. Retain all "Open Water" polygons, regardless of shape or area, in the new map. The ArcGIS "Eliminate Tool" was used for this process step.

Create two new feature attributes "NAME_2010" and "ilu2010" and assign their values for each polygon. "NAME_2010" contains the land-use name assigned to each polygon. Most polygons were assigned land-use names on the basis of the LANDFIRE Existing Vegetation System Group Identification attribute values (SYTMGRPNA). All remaining polygons were assigned land-use names on the basis of crop types. "ilu2010" contains the identification number assigned to each land-use name.

Digitize boundaries of golf courses, and fields of sugarcane, pineapple, coffee, and taro. Also digitize boundaries of diversified-agriculture fields within the Kula Agricultural Park. Fields of diversified agriculture within the Kula Agricultural Park, golf courses, pineapple, coffee, and taro were digitized using 2010-2013 satellite imagery and 2007 orthoimagery. Fields of sugarcane were digitized using a plantation-divisions map, dated July 2008, that was provided by Hawaiian Commercial and Sugar Company. Assign the following land-use name values and identification numbers (NAME_2010, ilu1010): (Sugarcane, 1); (Pineapple, 2); (Coffee, 3); (Diversified Agriculture, 4); and (Golf course, 24).

Redefine land-use names (NAME_2010) of polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group name (SYTMGRPNA) of "Agriculture-Cultivated Crops and Irrigated Agriculture", hereafter referred to as "agriculture polygons". Agriculture polygons on the east slope of West Maui Mountain with groves of trees were redefined as "Macadamia". Agriculture polygons in the LANDFIRE map that are adjacent to but not within the fields of sugarcane, pineapple, coffee, or taro were assigned a land-use name (NAME_2010) of "Grassland", "Developed, Low-intensity", or "Developed, Open space" on the basis of the land use for nearby polygons. Agriculture polygons that appeared in the imagery as being uncultivated and covered by grass were redefined as "Fallow/grassland". All remaining agriculture polygons that appeared in the imagery as being actively cultivated were redefined as "Diversified Agriculture".

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Name of dominant land use or vegetation.

edom.edomvds: Map of Hawaiian Commercial and Sugar Company's sugarcane fields.
Digitized from 2010-13 satellite imagery and 2007 orthoimagery.

edom.edomvd: Polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of "Agriculture-Cultivated Crops and Irrigated Agriculture" that (1) appear in imagery as being actively cultivated, and (2) are not sugarcane, pineapple, coffee, macadamia, or taro. Also includes diversified agriculture fields within the Kula Agricultural Park that were digitized and some fields near Hawaiian Commercial and Sugarcane Company's fields.
edom.edomvds: LANDFIRE Existing Vegetation Type Map (Refresh 2008), 2010-13 satellite imagery, and 2007 orthoimagery.

edom.edomvd: Polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of "Agriculture-Cultivated Crops and Irrigated Agriculture" that appear in imagery as being macadamia trees.
edom.edomvds: LANDFIRE Existing Vegetation Type Map (Refresh 2008), 2010-13 satellite imagery, and land-use maps within U.S. Geological Survey Scientific Investigations Report 2007-5103

edom.edomvd: Polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of "Agriculture-Cultivated Crops and Irrigated Agriculture" that appear in imagery as being abandoned and covered by grass.
edom.edomvds: LANDFIRE Existing Vegetation Type Map (Refresh 2008) and 2010-13 satellite imagery

edom.edomvd: Consists of (1) polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of "Developed, Open Space", and (2) some polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of "Agriculture-Cultivated Crops and Irrigated Agriculture" that are adjacent to but not within digitized fields of sugarcane, pineapple, or coffee. Includes areas that are a mixture of mostly vegetation in the form of lawn grasses and some constructed materials. Impervious surfaces account for less than 20 percent of total cover.

Consists of (1) polygons with LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of "Developed, Low-Intensity", and (2) some polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of "Agriculture-Cultivated Crops and Irrigated Agriculture" that are adjacent to but not within digitized fields of sugarcane, pineapple, or coffee. Includes areas with a mixture of constructed materials and vegetation. Impervious surfaces account for 20-49 percent of total cover.

Polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of "Developed, Medium-Intensity". Includes areas with a mixture of constructed materials and vegetation. Impervious surfaces account for 50-79 percent of the total cover.

Polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of "Developed, High-Intensity". Includes highly developed areas where people reside or work in high numbers. Impervious surfaces account for 80-100 percent of total cover.
Polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of "Open Water", excluding reservoirs.
Polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of "Inland Marshes and Prairies".
Polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of "Barren".

Includes polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of “Hawaiian Dry Grassland”, “Hawaiian Mesic Grassland", or “Introduced Perennial Grassland and Forbland”. Also includes some polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of "Agriculture-Cultivated Crops and Irrigated Agriculture" that are adjacent to but not within digitized fields of sugarcane, pineapple, coffee, and taro.
Polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of either “Hawaiian Dry Shrubland”, “Hawaiian Mesic Shrubland”, or “Introduced Upland Vegetation – Shrub”.
Polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of either “Hawaiian Dry Forest”, “Hawaiian Mesic Forest”, or “Hawaiian Rainforest”.
Polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of “Introduced Upland Vegetation – Treed”.
Polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of "Hawaiian Managed Tree Plantation".
Polygons that are reservoirs. Includes some polygons with a LANDFIRE System Group (SYSTMGRPNA) value of "Open Water", and some reservoirs near sugarcane fields that were digitized.
edom.edomvds: LANDFIRE Existing Vegetation Type Map (Refresh 2008), 2010-13 satellite imagery, and 2007 orthoimagery.
2010-13 satellite imagery, 2007 orthoimagery, and U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report 2007-1157.
